title.narrative: School Rehabilitation and Support Programme of Baptist Convention Sierra Leone Additional years 2.-3.

description.narrative: We have completed a school project at Gberray Junction Lunsar and Makeni in four schools over the years 2015-2018. The project has two additional buildings and one renovation work for one school. Schools are equipped with furniture and school supplies. Thr ee schools have been assisted in setting up a school garden. Girls' schooling is supported by school uniforms. Some of the school teachers are unqualified and many do not get wages from the state. We have been assisting teachers who are insecure for wages with rice barn donations. Workshops have been held for untrained teachers and administrators.The project carried out an external evaluation in the spring of 2018. We were asked to pay attention to sustainable development in our schools that we have built a nd renovated. We were suggested to work on girls' schooling alongside distributing school uniforms and to develop a sustainable way to produce school uniforms.Secondly it was urged to support the qualification of teachers either through training events or by supporting their formal qualifications as a basis for supporting the implementation of pupil-based teaching philosophy at schools.Third it was urged to look at school dropouts and how to prevent school dropout which will hinder the achievement of the ob jectives of the projects that have been carried out so far.We have planned a follow-up to the measures supporting these goals. We will continue to donate girls' school uniforms but we plan to continue the activity in cooperation with the Makama vocational school which has been our project school in 2002-2005. In that school we work with girls. We also look at their school path until employment and share handcraft ideas. In all schools we monitor the development and real activity of pupils and educate our st aff.Ripe sausages are still part of the project to support teachers. We monitor the use of school gardens for teachers and children. Workshops for child-centered teaching continue.At the Prince of Peace School we assist in the additional building that the project has moved on and the number of students has now increased. At school in Magbenteh we help with water supply and sanitation.
